pr_title: [WFLY-13570] Add the ability to adjust the case of a user name using an Elytron principal transformer

timeline.bodyText: Instead of removing the principal transformer, you could make use of a second security domain that doesn't have a principal transformer configured
timeline.author: fjuma

replies.bodyText: I pushed a new commit where I used different domains to tackle the cases where the principal transformer is configured to adjust to lower case and a domain with no principal transformer. I pushed this as a separate commit just so in case I need to roll back to the previous state. Let me know if the new commit incorporates the feedback appropriately :)
replies.author: SoniaZaldana

timeline.bodyText:
It would also be good to have a test that makes use of a case-principal-transformer that sets upper-case to false.
Just a minor comment but it would also be good to give these tests names that indicate what the test is checking - e.g., testCasePrincipalTransformerUpperCase
timeline.author: fjuma

timeline.bodyText: To simplify things slightly, what do you think about having a helper method that creates a domain, optionally adds a transformer to that domain, and adds the application security domain mapping to the Undertow config? That way, instead of calling each of these helper methods various times, we could just call that single method for each domain?
timeline.author: fjuma

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the feedback! I refactored everything into one method in the latest commit
replies.author: SoniaZaldana
